events.name: I School Hackathon - IDH 2012
events.about:
Welcome to the first student run hackathon at the UC Berkeley School of Information!

Join us on Saturday, October 27 for a full day of work and fun.  

You can find more information about the event at - https://blogs.ischool.berkeley.edu/idh2012/

EVENT DETAILS

When:
Saturday, October 27, 2012
8AM to 8PM (or so)

Where: 
South Hall, UC Berkeley School of Information

Registration
$20 for students, $40 for non-students. 

Prizes:
Grand Prize: $1000
Best Application: TBD
Best Visualization: TBD
Best Use of Data: TBD
events.address: UC Berkeley School of Information 102 South Hall Road

events.name: The Hacker Games: Berkeley Qualification Round and Mixer
events.about:
The Hacker Games is an annual competition between hackers from the best universities in the country. Five winners from each university will be flown to San Francisco to compete in the The Hacker Games hackathon.

The Hacker Games Berkeley Qualification Round and Mixer is on October 13, 2012.  Youll hear from some of the best startups in the area, meet amazing people, and have a chance to win awesome prizes.  Five winners from Berkeley will be flown to San Francisco to participate in the The Hacker Games Hackathon Final. 

You must register with a Berkeley .edu address to be eligible to attend this event.

events.name: The Big Hack, Part II
events.about:
Cal vs. Stanford Hackathon, Part II. Lets do this.

Sponsors:

Tendril, NREL, Lester Center for Entrepreneurship, Hackers at Berkeley, Stanford ACM, Bauer Transportation

events.name: The Big Hack
events.about:
This is a 24-hour hackathon between UC Berkeley and Stanford. Please check the Facebook event for all logistical details, including schedule, food, prizes, etc.

This event will be hosted on the Stanford campus, so if you need transportation from Berkeley, please register with the ticket that has transportation!

The bus will leave promptly from Berkeley at 11:00AM on Saturday, April 14 outside the 4th floor of Soda Hall (on the intersection of Hearst and Le Roy).
events.address: Le Roy Ave and Hearst Ave

events.name: Code 4 Cal hackathon
events.about:
The Student Technology Council (STC), which advises the University CIO Shel Waggener on student technology needs, is hosting Code 4 Cal, a hackathon for students to create innovative, sustainable, and most of all, useful applications or widgets for Berkeley students. The event starts at 9:00 pm Friday, February 3, and continues until 5:00 pm Saturday, February 4, in Soda Halls Wozniak Lounge.

All coding enthusiasts who are also registered students are encouraged to participate and must pre-register. Registration will open Tuesday, January 24, at 8:00 pm.

Student-developed apps may be adopted by the University. Grand Prize is $1,500. Interested parties should attend the Code 4 Cal information session Tuesday, January 24, at 5:00 pm in 202 South Hall.

Code 4 Cal in brief

  • Information session: Tuesday, January 24, 5:00 pm, 202 South Hall
  • Registration: Opens Tuesday, January 24, 8:00 pm, STC website.
  • Hackathon: Friday, February 3, 9:00 pm, through Saturday, February 4, 5:00 pm, Wozniak Lounge, Soda Hall
  • Grand Prize: $1,500
  • More information and registration details: STC Competitions.
events.address: University of California, Berkeley  - Soda Hall - Wozniak Lounge
